titleInfo.title: Polk et al v. Dent et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM Opinion and Order. We grant Defendant Dent's motion to dismiss 24 in its entirety, and we grant the City of Chicago's motion to dismiss 27 with regard to each of Plaintiffs' claims except Booker and Dawson's assault, battery, and related indemnification claims against Unknown Officer Defendants. Because we do not have jurisdiction over these remaining state claims, we remand the case to state court. It is so ordered. Hearing date of 9/11/14 is stricken. Civil case terminated. Signed by the Honorable Marvin E. Aspen on 8/28/2014. Notice mailed by judge's staff(ntf, )

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 1:13-cv-09321; Polk et al v. Dent et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Northern District of Illinois
extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM Opinion and Order. We grant Defendant Dent's motion to dismiss 24 in its entirety, and we grant the City of Chicago's motion to dismiss 27 with regard to each of Plaintiffs' claims except Booker and Dawson's assault, battery, and related indemnification claims against Unknown Officer Defendants. Because we do not have jurisdiction over these remaining state claims, we remand the case to state court. It is so ordered. Hearing date of 9/11/14 is stricken. Civil case terminated. Signed by the Honorable Marvin E. Aspen on 8/28/2014. Notice mailed by judge's staff(ntf, )

titleInfo.title: Polk et al v. Dent et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM Opinion and Order. Plaintiffs motion to amend their complaint 46 is denied as futile. In addition, Plaintiffs' motion for reconsideration 44 is granted in part and our August 28, 2014 ruling is amended consistent with the discussion above. The case is reopened and Plaintiffs may proceed in federal court on the following claims: (1) all Plaintiffs' Monell claims against the City (Counts 1, 2, 4, 5, 8); (2) Dawson's state and federal claims against Unknown Officers (Counts 17, 9) and the related indemnification claim (Count 10); and (3) Bookers and Dawsons respondeat superior state claims against the City (Counts 3, 6, 7, 9). It is so ordered. Civil case reopened. Signed by the Honorable Marvin E. Aspen on 1/5/2015. Notice mailed by judge's staff (ntf, )

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 1:13-cv-09321; Polk et al v. Dent et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Northern District of Illinois
extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM Opinion and Order. Plaintiffs motion to amend their complaint 46 is denied as futile. In addition, Plaintiffs' motion for reconsideration 44 is granted in part and our August 28, 2014 ruling is amended consistent with the discussion above. The case is reopened and Plaintiffs may proceed in federal court on the following claims: (1) all Plaintiffs' Monell claims against the City (Counts 1, 2, 4, 5, 8); (2) Dawson's state and federal claims against Unknown Officers (Counts 17, 9) and the related indemnification claim (Count 10); and (3) Bookers and Dawsons respondeat superior state claims against the City (Counts 3, 6, 7, 9). It is so ordered. Civil case reopened. Signed by the Honorable Marvin E. Aspen on 1/5/2015. Notice mailed by judge's staff (ntf, )

titleInfo.title: Polk et al v. Dent et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM Opinion and Order Signed by the Honorable Marvin E. Aspen on 5/19/2015: The City of Chicago's motion to dismiss Plaintiffs' claims for equitable relief 59 is granted. Plaintiffs may pursue their Monell claims against the City and their related request for monetary damages, but they are not entitled to equitable relief on these claims. Mailed notice(mad, )
